H0.text: Nuclear bombs put a much larger fraction of their output into thermal energy than do conventional bombs.

H1.text: Dense bombs put a much larger fraction of their output into thermal energy than conventional bombs.

H2.text: Dirty bombs are bombs that put a much larger fraction of their output into thermal energy than do conventional bombs.

H3.text: TNT bombs put a much larger fraction of their output into thermal energy than do conventional bombs.
